speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: SCENE V. Another part of the field.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Alarum. Enter KING RICHARD III and RICHMOND; they  fight. KING RICHARD III is slain. Retreat and  flourish. Re-enter RICHMOND, DERBY bearing the crown, with divers other Lords

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: God and your arms be praised, victorious friends,

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: The day is ours, the bloody dog is dead.

speaker: DERBY
text_entry: Courageous Richmond, well hast thou acquit thee.

speaker: DERBY
text_entry: Lo, here, this long-usurped royalty

speaker: DERBY
text_entry: From the dead temples of this bloody wretch

speaker: DERBY
text_entry: Have I pluck'd off, to grace thy brows withal:

speaker: DERBY
text_entry: Wear it, enjoy it, and make much of it.

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: Great God of heaven, say Amen to all!

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: But, tell me, is young George Stanley living?

speaker: DERBY
text_entry: He is, my lord, and safe in Leicester town;

speaker: DERBY
text_entry: Whither, if it please you, we may now withdraw us.

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: What men of name are slain on either side?

speaker: DERBY
text_entry: John Duke of Norfolk, Walter Lord Ferrers,

speaker: DERBY
text_entry: Sir Robert Brakenbury, and Sir William Brandon.

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: Inter their bodies as becomes their births:

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: Proclaim a pardon to the soldiers fled

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: That in submission will return to us:

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: And then, as we have ta'en the sacrament,

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: We will unite the white rose and the red:

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: Smile heaven upon this fair conjunction,

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: That long have frown'd upon their enmity!

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: What traitor hears me, and says not amen?

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: England hath long been mad, and scarr'd herself;

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: The brother blindly shed the brother's blood,

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: The father rashly slaughter'd his own son,

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: The son, compell'd, been butcher to the sire:

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: All this divided York and Lancaster,

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: Divided in their dire division,

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: O, now, let Richmond and Elizabeth,

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: The true succeeders of each royal house,

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: By God's fair ordinance conjoin together!

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: And let their heirs, God, if thy will be so.

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: Enrich the time to come with smooth-faced peace,

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: With smiling plenty and fair prosperous days!

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: Abate the edge of traitors, gracious Lord,

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: That would reduce these bloody days again,

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: And make poor England weep in streams of blood!

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: Let them not live to taste this land's increase

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: That would with treason wound this fair land's peace!

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: Now civil wounds are stopp'd, peace lives again:

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: That she may long live here, God say amen!

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: Exeunt
